principles: A man is often secretly oppressed by the role he has to play—by always having to be responsible, in control, and rational.
Women want attention, but men are too often distracted and unresponsive.
Ideal Lovers thrive on people's broken dreams, which become lifelong fantasies.
rules: To seduce someone, you need to fill a void in their life.
The perfect victim has some quality that inspires strong emotions in you.
You should approach indirectly and create a false sense of security before striking.

claims.claim: A Siren is the ultimate male fantasy figure because she offers a total release from the limitations of his life.
The Rake is a great female fantasy-figure—when he desires a woman, brief though that moment may be, he will go to the ends of the earth for her.
Charmers are consummate manipulators, masking their cleverness by creating a mood of pleasure and comfort.

warnings: Anti-seducers have no self-awareness, and never realize when they are pestering, imposing, talking too much.
The completely contented person is almost impossible to seduce.

principles: Create an aura of desirability to draw people closer and make them hungry for your attention.
Stir within people feelings of discontent, inadequacy, and unhappiness with their circumstances and themselves.
Use insinuation to plant ideas in people's minds by dropping elusive hints that take root days later.
Enter the spirit of others by playing by their rules, enjoying what they enjoy, and adapting yourself to their moods.
Create temptation by awakening a desire in people that they cannot control.
Keep people in suspense by creating calculated surprises and doing things they do not expect from you.
Use the demonic power of words to sow confusion and make people listen by saying what they want to hear.
Pay attention to detail and distract people with pleasant little rituals, such as thoughtful gifts and gestures.
Poeticize your presence by alternating exciting moments with calculated absences and associating yourself with poetic images and objects.
Disarm through strategic weakness and vulnerability by making the other person feel superior and stronger.
Confuse desire and reality by creating the illusion that you can help people live out their dreams.
Isolate the victim by taking them away from their normal milieu, friends, family, and home.
rules: Do not be too obvious in your attempts to seduce others.
Use sublanguage to convey your real meaning without being too explicit.
Make everything suggestive to keep people interested and engaged.
Remain elusive and intriguing by alternating exciting presence with cool distance.
Associate yourself with poetic images and objects to create an idealized halo around you.

claims.claim: You can seduce others by creating an aura of desirability and using insinuation to plant ideas in their minds.
People are more likely to be seduced if they feel discontent, inadequate, and unhappy with their circumstances.
The use of calculated surprises and pleasant little rituals can keep people engaged and interested.
You can disarm others by making them feel superior and stronger through strategic weakness and vulnerability.

warnings: Be careful not to be too obvious in your attempts to seduce others, as this may raise suspicion.
Do not overexpose yourself or become too familiar with the people you are trying to seduce, as this can cause them to lose interest.
Be aware of the potential consequences of using insinuation and manipulation to achieve your goals.

principles: People will try to repeat or relive pleasurable memories from their past.
The deepest-rooted and most pleasurable memories are usually those from earliest childhood.
rules: Position your target as the needy child in the oedipal triangle to create an emotional response.
Making targets feel like they're leading them past social limits can be immensely seductive.

claims.claim: Unaware of the cause of their emotional response, people will fall in love with you.
The shared feeling of guilt and complicity will create a powerful bond.

chapters.chapter_title: Phase Four: Moving In for the Kill
principles: The greatest mistake in seduction is being too nice.
To heighten the erotic charge, create the excitement of fear.
rules: Make them feel guilty and insecure.
Instigate a breakup—now a rapprochement, a return to your earlier kindness, will turn them weak at the knees.

claims.claim: A woman can always toy with a man's insatiable desire for sex.
Women have no choice but to submit to this condition.

warnings: Danger follows in the aftermath of a successful seduction.
If you are to part, make the sacrifice swift and sudden.

principles: Seduction is a game of psychology, not beauty.
A seducer does not turn the power off and on—every social and personal interaction is seen as a potential seduction.
The power seducers have over a man or woman works in social environments because they have learned how to tone down the sexual element without getting rid of it.
rules: Never be forceful or direct; instead, use pleasure as bait, playing on people's emotions, stirring desire and confusion, inducing psychological surrender.
Seducers take their time, create enchantment and the bonds of love, so that when sex ensues it only further enslaves the victim.

claims.claim: The ability to seduce is a powerful form of power in the modern world.
Seduction can be used for social, political, or personal gain.
A person in love will surrender to the will of the loved one and to their desire to possess them.

warnings: Repressing the desire to seduce is a kind of hysterical reaction, revealing your deep-down fascination with the process;
Some day they will come to the surface.
Trying to divide your life into moments in which you seduce and others may not be effective.

principles: Seduction is a process of penetration: initially penetrating the target's mind, their first point of defense.
A seducer sees love not as sacred but as warfare, where all is fair.
The main obstacle to becoming a seducer is this foolish prejudice we have of seeing love and romance as some kind of sacred, magical realm where things just fall into place, if they are meant to.
rules: A seducer does not improvise; they do not leave this process to chance. Like any good general, they plan and strategize, aiming at the target's particular weaknesses.
Seducers see themselves as providers of pleasure, like bees that gather pollen from some flowers and deliver it to others.

claims.claim: What exists in love is surrender due to enchantment.
The combination of these two elements, enchantment and surrender, is, then, essential to the love which we are discussing.

warnings: Leaving things to chance is a recipe for disaster, and reveals that we do not take love and romance very seriously.
Falling in love is a matter not of magic but of psychology.

principles: Successful seductions begin with your character, your ability to radiate some quality that attracts people and stirs their emotions in a way that is beyond their control.

claims.claim: Most virtue is a demand for greater seduction.

A man is often secretly oppressed by the role he has to play—by always having to be responsible, in control, and rational. The Siren is the ultimate male fantasy figure because she offers a total release from the limitations of his life.

warnings: At all cost you must root out any anti-seductive tendencies you may have.
If you ignore any part of this book, you will be an incomplete seducer.

principles: A theatrical streak allows a woman to embody a man's fantasies.
Create the illusion that you offer variety and adventure to keep a man interested.

claims.claim: It is not beauty that makes a Siren, but rather a woman who can create the illusion of offering variety and adventure.
A man is easily deceived by appearances; he has a weakness for the visual.

warnings: Never let a man see who you really are; keep up the distractions to maintain his interest.

principles: Seduction lies in the annulment of signs and their meaning, in pure appearance.

claims.claim: A woman can gain power and attention by manipulating her physical presence and appearance.
The key to seduction is not just about physical attractiveness, but also about creating an air of innocence and vulnerability.
A woman's voice, walk, and manner can be used to create a seductive effect on men.

warnings: Beware of the dangers of using manipulation and deception to achieve one's goals.
The use of seduction can lead to exploitation and harm if not done with care and respect.

principles: A Siren must distinguish herself from other women through her sense of high drama, physicality, or other unique qualities.
To get a man to pursue her, a Siren must have a highly sexual presence and be slightly elusive and distant.
Danger is critical in seduction, adding emotional spice and appealing to men's rational and repressed nature.
rules: A Siren should not resemble a courtesan or whore, whom the male may pursue only to quickly lose interest in her.
To protect himself from a Siren's influence, a man must work and follow a straight path in life, ignoring distractions and temptations.

claims.claim: A highly feminine and sexual presence can differentiate a Siren from other women and make her more attractive to men.
The notion of danger, challenge, or death can add emotional spice to seduction and appeal to men's rational and repressed nature.

warnings: Men who are oppressed by their own reasonableness may be attracted to Sirens' irrationality and unpredictability.
A man can be ruined by a Siren, yet cannot tear himself away from her influence.

principles: A Siren's main instrument of power is her physical appearance.
A Siren must create an overall impression that is both distracting and alluring.
The voice, body, and adornment of a Siren must be harmonious and cast a spell.

claims.claim: A beautiful face does not make a Siren.
A Siren's appearance must stimulate a generalized desire.
A Siren's voice has an immediate animal presence with incredible suggestive power.

warnings: The intense attention that a Siren attracts can prove irritating and worse.
Physical beauty fades, and past a certain age, the Siren effect gets hard to project.

principles: Intense desire has a distracting power on a woman, just as the Siren's physical presence does on a man.

A woman is often defensive and can sense insincerity or calculation. But if she feels consumed by your attentions, and is confident you will do anything for her, she will notice nothing else about you, or will find a way to forgive your indiscretions.
rules: To seduce, one must calculate and plan, but also show no hesitation, abandon all restraint, let oneself go, and show that one cannot control oneself and is fundamentally weak.
The key to seduction is to make the woman feel consumed by your attentions, and confident that you will do anything for her.

claims.claim: Gabriele D'Annunzio was a remarkable lover who could inspire intense desire in women, making them forget their defenses and forgive his indiscretions.
D'Annunzio's voice had a hypnotic effect on women, making them feel that their very soul and being were lifted.

warnings: If you seem to be in control, you will inspire fear instead of desire.
If your victim suspects that you have ulterior motives, she will grow defensive.

principles: Seduction is a psychological process that transcends gender.
The male is traditionally vulnerable to the visual, while women are susceptible to language and words.
The Rake's use of language is demonic because it is designed not to communicate but to persuade and stir emotional turmoil.
rules: Adapt the character of the Rake and you will find that the use of words as a subtle poison has infinite applications.
Give your words a lofty, spiritual, literary flavor to insinuate desire in your unwitting victims.

claims.claim: The Rake offers what society normally does not allow women: an affair of pure pleasure and excitement.
A woman is often deeply oppressed by the role she is expected to play, but the Rake gives her romance and devotion without routine or distraction.
The great seducers touch a person's unconscious, those repressed desires that cry out for liberation.

warnings: Do not imagine that women are the tender creatures that some people would like them to be. Like men, they are deeply attracted to the forbidden.

principles: To play the Rake, you must convey a sense of risk and darkness, suggesting to your victim that she is participating in something rare and thrilling—a chance to play out her own rakish desires.

The Rake never worries about a woman's resistance to him, or for that matter about any other obstacle in his path—a husband, a physical barrier. Resistance is only the spur to his desire, enflaming him all the more.
rules: To play the Rake, you must create resistances or obstacles for yourself.
The Rake needs a backdrop of convention—a stultified court, a humdrum marriage, a conservative culture—to shine, to be appreciated for the breath of fresh air he provides.

claims.claim: A woman may feel ambivalence about President Clinton's reputation, but beneath that ambivalence is an underlying interest.
The desire to reform him disguises the true nature of their desire, the secret thrill they get from him.

warnings: Like the Siren, the Rake faces the most danger from members of his own sex, who are far less indulgent than women are of his constant skirt chasing.
The greater danger for the Rake comes not from the violently offended husband but from those insecure men who feel threatened by the Don Juan figure.

principles: Seduction is a legitimate means to achieve power and connection with others.
Idealizing someone's fantasy can be a powerful way to create a deep emotional connection.

claims.claim: Casanova was perhaps the most successful seducer in history; few women could resist him.
Seduction is the source of power, and it can bring people together despite their differences.

warnings: Envy and jealousy can be destructive forces that can undermine relationships and reputations.
Idealizing someone's fantasy can lead to disappointment and disillusionment if not managed carefully.

principles: To be an effective seducer, one must focus intensely on the other person and understand what they are missing.
Adapting oneself to the woman's ideals can bring her fantasy to life and seal the romance.

claims.claim: The cultivation of the pleasures of the senses was ever my principal aim in life.
Knowing that I was personally calculated to please the fair sex, I always strove to make myself agreeable to it.

warnings: Most people are so wrapped up in their own desires, so impatient, they are incapable of the Ideal Lover role. Let that be a source of infinite opportunity.
Be an oasis in the desert of the self-absorbed; few can resist the temptation of following a person who seems so attuned to their desires.

principles: Appeal to people's better selves, rather than their physical side, to create a lasting and powerful connection.
Understand that people have an ideal or unfulfilled desire within themselves, which can be tapped into through seduction.
The key to successful seduction is the ability to observe and understand the other person's desires and needs.
rules: Never appeal only to a person's physical side, as this will lead to resentment and a lack of connection.
Always focus on creating a sense of elevation and loftiness in the other person, rather than just satisfying their physical desires.

claims.claim: Love can bring out a person's noble and hidden qualities, making them feel more elevated and spiritual.
The ideal lover has the power to make people feel great and powerful, by appealing to their better selves.

warnings: Power is a taboo topic in modern society, but it is a reality that must be acknowledged and understood in order to succeed in seduction.
Ideal lovers can be deceiving, as they often disguise their manipulations behind the facade of an ideal or higher standard of beauty.

principles: Appeal to people's higher selves and lost ideals.
Create a fantasy that involves an idealization of your own character.
Hint at something for them to aspire to, reveal your faith in some untapped potential you see in them.

claims.claim: Ideal Lovers are masters at seducing people by appealing to their higher selves.
People are always vulnerable to insinuations that stroke their vanity.
Hinting at something for them to aspire to, reveals your faith in some untapped potential you see in them.

warnings: The main dangers in the role of the Ideal Lover are the consequences that arise if you let reality creep in.
Reality and long intimate exposure have a way of dulling a person's perfection.
When reality intrudes, distance is often a solution.

principles: Seduction was and will always remain the female form of power and warfare.

claims.claim: Women were beginning to play with a new sexual freedom in the 1920s.
Valentino understood this perfectly, as he played characters that appealed to women's desires for initiation and conquest.
Seduction was originally the antidote to rape and violence.

warnings: The man who uses seduction on a woman is in essence turning the game around, and may be seen as using power over her.

principles: The power of seduction lies not in being devastatingly masculine, but in mirroring feminine psychology and displaying a subtle blend of male and female charm.

claims.claim: Women are narcissists, in love with the charms of their own sex.
By showing them feminine charm, a man can mesmerize and disarm them, leaving them vulnerable to a bold, masculine move.

warnings: The Feminine Dandy can seduce on a mass scale. No single woman really possesses him—he is too elusive—but all can fantasize about doing so.

principles: Conformity offers untold possibilities of power and seduction to those who are up for a few risks.
Dandies thrive on the conformist role playing of others.

claims.claim: The Dandy displays a true and radical difference from other people, a difference of appearance and manner.
Most people are drawn to those who are more fluid and flaunt their difference.

warnings: Never complain about most people's slavish conformity, for it offers untold possibilities of power and seduction to those who are up for a few risks.

principles: Adopting an attitude of nonconformity and disdain for convention can be a key element in seduction.
Impudence and insolence towards society and its conventions can be attractive to people who feel oppressed by the obligation of always being polite and self-sacrificing.
rules: To create your own fashion sense, adapt and alter prevailing styles to make yourself an object of fascination.
Surround yourself with beautiful objects and eat and drink with relish to alleviate boredom and make life an art.

claims.claim: The Dandy has the power to seduce people by dominating them through a usurpation of femininity.
By adopting psychological traits of the opposite sex, Dandies can appeal to our inherent narcissism and create a pleasing effect.

warnings: The tyranny of elegance can become insupportable, leading to ennui and frustration.
Imposing an attitude on others can make you a nuisance and be counterproductive in seduction.

principles: Ambiguity is key to power and seduction.
Being both masculine and feminine can be highly attractive and seductive.
rules: Do not try to fight the image you have created as a Dandy; instead, accept society's occasional gibes with grace and insolence.
Be mindful of your impudence and avoid insulting those in a position to injure you.

claims.claim: The Dandy figure has been seductive to women for centuries.
A feminine-looking face can have more seductive power than a masculine one.

warnings: Working through transgressive feelings relating to sex roles can be dangerous and lead to resentment from others.
Being too insolent or impudent can have its limits and may lead to negative consequences.

principles: To assume the role of the Natural, mentally position yourself in any relationship as the child, the younger one.
Play up any natural weaknesses or flaws to elicit sympathy and laughter.
Be open to experience and receptive to others' influence to lower inhibitions and create a seductive atmosphere.
rules: Do not apologize or look contrite when offending people; instead, keep a glint in your eye to show you do not take anything seriously.
Hide the sweat behind what you do to make it appear effortless and natural.

claims.claim: The Natural type is seductive because of their childlike traits, such as innocence, impishness, and wonder.
Adult Naturals can retain their youthful impulsiveness and improvisational skills to remain seductive.

warnings: Defensiveness is deadly in seduction; act defensive and you'll bring out defensiveness in other people.
Do not try to act innocent or childish if it comes across as pathetic or insincere.
